poem:
"Journey of Inheritance"

No words are spoken, yet our stories interweave,
Hung on the drapes of ancestor's hands.
A brother of power, now in mother's shadow,
Daughter of silence, finding her stand.
Each hallowed belonging, a quiet echo,
Awakens echoes of family, this strife-ridden band.
But remember, we are swirling stardust,
Carved in earth's memory, in this inheritance land.
